extendedIngredients.name: canned chickpeas
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cans (15 ounces each) garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained

extendedIngredients.name: canned diced tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) diced tomatoes, undrained

extendedIngredients.name: chicken broth
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cans (10-1/2 ounces each) condensed chicken broth, undiluted

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1-1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1/2-inch cubes

recipes.title: Chicken Chili

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken Chili works really well with Cava, Grenache, and Shiraz. These juicy reds don't have too much tannin (important for spicy foods), but a sparkling wine like cava can tame the heat even better. The Freixenet Sparkling Cordon Negro Brut Cava with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 10 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Freixenet Sparkling Cordon Negro Brut Cava
productMatches.description: A Cava with an exceptional, fresh, fruity style and a lingering aroma. It is the perfect partner for the finest food and excellent at any time.Blend: 35% Macabeo, 25% XarelÂ·lo, 40% Parellada

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a 5-qt. Dutch oven, saute the onions, green peppers and garlic in oil until onion is tender. Add chicken; cook and stir for 4 minutes or until browned.                                                                                            Add the next 10 ingredients; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add beans; cook, uncovered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Discard bay leaf.                                        Yield: 14 serving (3-1/2 quarts).                                                                                                                         Originally published as Chicken Chili in  Country Chicken Cookbook1995, p22                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                            Diabetic Exchanges: One 1-cup serving (prepared with low-sodium tomatoes and broth and without added salt) equals 2 lean meat, 1 starch, 1 vegetable; also, 222 calories, 230 mg sodium, 49 mg cholesterol, 26 gm carbohydrate, 18 gm protein, 6 gm fat.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a 5-qt. Dutch oven, saute the onions, green peppers and garlic in oil until onion is tender.
Add chicken; cook and stir for 4 minutes or until browned.
Add the next 10 ingredients; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add beans; cook, uncovered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Discard bay leaf.
